title: Type Scale: Building a Harmonious System
description: A quick win: understand Type Scale: Building a Harmonious System.

hook.text: Random font sizes â€” 13px, 17px, 22px, 31px â€” feel chaotic. A type scale brings order.

buildup.text: A type scale is a set of sizes related by a consistent ratio, like musical intervals.

discovery.text: The 'major third' scale (ratio 1.25) is popular: 16, 20, 25, 31.25. Each step feels naturally bigger.

twist.text: You don't need many sizes. Most designs work beautifully with just 5-7 scale steps.

climax.text: Design systems like Material and IBM Carbon publish their type scales for anyone to use.

punchline.text: Pick a ratio. Trust the math. Let the scale do the work.
